title: opeael2
author: opeael2
created_time: December 28, 2022, 04:35:49 PMLast edit: December 29, 2022, 12:12:50 PM by opeael2
content: Hello GuysCan Anybody have some better setting for this RTX than def 4096 and 256 ??i have speed as on screen https://images92.fotosik.pl/639/6a3d091bec1d0e53med.png

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: opeael2 on December 28, 2022, 04:35:49 PMHello GuysCan Anybody have some better setting for this RTX than def 4096 and 256 ??i have speed as on screen quote pictureWhile mining is not profitable, miners crack forgotten passwords to cryptocurrency wallets  I think it is better to look for this information on the technical support forums or social networks BTCRecover. But 2 video cards are not enough to enumerate passwords.

comments.author: Daltonik
comments.body: Quote from: opeael2 on December 28, 2022, 04:35:49 PMHello GuysCan Anybody have some better setting for this RTX than def 4096 and 256 ??i have speed as on screen Yes, there are a lot of pools now that are engaged in the selection of private keys to "forgotten" bitcoin wallets, as for the parameters for your card, read here https://github.com/gurnec/btcrecover/blob/master/docs/GPU_Acceleration.md and try to use different values for optimal performance of your card.Well you can.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: opeael2 on December 28, 2022, 04:35:49 PMHello GuysCan Anybody have some better setting for this RTX than def 4096 and 256 ??i have speed as on screen I tried to use that tool but it didn't work out well for me despite me having quite some decent GPU-s running the program trying to recover my password.I got bored and there was a user here which I believe he still is by the name Dave that has a Wallet Recovery Service somewhere on the forum,just search it here or in google and he cracked a long huge password with his software that he claims to keep 10-20% of the amount of the wallets he recover.Unfortunately I had 0 money there despite me thinking there were some near 4000-5000 dollars but the fact is that he can help anyone and I am sure he can find your password no matter what your password was as long as he has that wallet.dat file.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: How do you find a password if it's 20-30 characters, letters and numbers and you don't have password hints?You can spend a lot of time on enumeration of passwords and will not achieve results. Miners were offered such projects, but the reward is given only in case of success. But miners are not stupid people.

comments.author: Daltonik
comments.body: Quote from: swogerino on December 30, 2022, 02:52:26 PMQuote from: opeael2 on December 28, 2022, 04:35:49 PMHello GuysCan Anybody have some better setting for this RTX than def 4096 and 256 ??i have speed as on screen I tried to use that tool but it didn't work out well for me despite me having quite some decent GPU-s running the program trying to recover my password.I got bored and there was a user here which I believe he still is by the name Dave that has a Wallet Recovery Service somewhere on the forum,just search it here or in google and he cracked a long huge password with his software that he claims to keep 10-20% of the amount of the wallets he recover.Unfortunately I had 0 money there despite me thinking there were some near 4000-5000 dollars but the fact is that he can help anyone and I am sure he can find your password no matter what your password was as long as he has that wallet.dat file.Yes, I also met this topic, but if I'm not mistaken, it was about puzzle # 64 and he used several dozen A100s to solve it, and it seems he used his program Rotor-Cuda, which really iterates over the range very effectively.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: Daltonik on December 31, 2022, 01:23:11 PMQuote from: swogerino on December 30, 2022, 02:52:26 PMQuote from: opeael2 on December 28, 2022, 04:35:49 PMHello GuysCan Anybody have some better setting for this RTX than def 4096 and 256 ??i have speed as on screen I tried to use that tool but it didn't work out well for me despite me having quite some decent GPU-s running the program trying to recover my password.I got bored and there was a user here which I believe he still is by the name Dave that has a Wallet Recovery Service somewhere on the forum,just search it here or in google and he cracked a long huge password with his software that he claims to keep 10-20% of the amount of the wallets he recover.Unfortunately I had 0 money there despite me thinking there were some near 4000-5000 dollars but the fact is that he can help anyone and I am sure he can find your password no matter what your password was as long as he has that wallet.dat file.Yes, I also met this topic, but if I'm not mistaken, it was about puzzle # 64 and he used several dozen A100s to solve it, and it seems he used his program Rotor-Cuda, which really iterates over the range very effectively.From the long password I had at least 5 names of my relatives,some random numbers,random special characters like @ and ! and the only thing I remembered it was the name of a relative which was in the middle of the password.With just that information that guy hashed it out and found the password in less than one day,most of the old reputable members of the forum who post several posts there at that section was amazed how this guy found out my password and I also at first could not believe my eyes.The only regret is that unfortunately the 4000-5000 dollars was not at that wallet I completely forgot where they were,probably in a computer I have no access as it was a wallet from the 2014 era,February 2014 to be precise.It was about 28 characters long if I remember correctly.
